page.title: 09 Village expansion.
page.content: Ryefields is being built to be an extension of the Upper Lea Estate.It is being built by Wilcon Homes Ltd. They are planning to build 300 houses altogether.30 have been completed so far (June 1985).15 more are in the course of construction.It will take 10 years to complete the estate,and 22 acres of land will be used.So far only 2 roads have been named-Membris Way and Brookside. 30 men per day are employed on the site.The foreman is Mr.Thomas.There are 8 different types of house.37 have been sold already. The average number of bricks in a house is 19000.The materials are brought from various places e.g.bricks -Bedfordshire;cement-Dunstable;timber -imported from Norway;bathroom suites -Derbyshire;doors and windows-Lincoln; electrical fittings-West Midlands.
